006
007package renderer.models_TP;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011import renderer.scene.util.MeshMaker_TP;
012import renderer.scene.util.MeshType;
013
014/**
015   Create a solid model of a ring (an annulus)
016   in the xy-plane centered at the origin.
017<p>
018   See <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annulus_(mathematics)" target="_top">
019                https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annulus_(mathematics)</a>
020
021   @see RingSector
022*/
023public class Ring extends Model implements MeshMaker_TP
024{
025   public final double r1;
026   public final double r2;
027   public final int n;
028   public final int k;
029   public final MeshType type;
030
031   /**
032      Create a ring (annulus) in the xy-plane with outer
033      radius 1 and with inner radius 0.33, with 12 spokes
034      coming out of the center, and with 5 concentric circles.
035   */
036   public Ring( )
037   {
038      this(1.0, 0.33, 4, 12);
039   }
040
041
042   /**
043      Create a ring (annulus) in the xy-plane with outer
044      radius {@code r1} and with inner radius {@code r2},
045      with 12 spokes coming out of the center, and with
046      5 concentric circles.
047
048      @param r1  outer radius of the ring
049      @param r2  inner radius of the ring
050   */
051   public Ring(final double r1, final double r2)
052   {
053      this(r1, r2, 4, 12);
054   }
055
056
057   /**
058      Create a ring (annulus) in the xy-plane with outer
059      radius {@code r1} and with inner radius {@code r2},
060      with {@code k} spokes coming out of the center, and
061      with {@code n} concentric circles (not counting the
062      inner most circle).
063   <p>
064      If there are {@code k} spokes, then each circle around
065      the center will have {@code k} line segments. If there
066      are {@code n} concentric circles around the center (not
067      counting the inner most circle), then each spoke will
068      have {@code n} line segments.
069   <p>
070      There must be at least three spokes and at least one concentric circle.
071
072      @param r1  outer radius of the ring
073      @param r2  inner radius of the ring
074      @param n   number of concentric circles
075      @param k   number of spokes in the ring
076      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 1
077      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 3
078   */
079   public Ring(final double r1, final double r2,
080               final int n, final int k)
081   {
082      this(r1, r2, n, k, MeshType.HORIZONTAL);
083   }
084
085
086   /**
087      Create a ring (annulus) in the xy-plane with outer
088      radius {@code r1} and with inner radius {@code r2},
089      with {@code k} spokes coming out of the center, and
090      with {@code n} concentric circles (not counting the
091      inner most circle).
092   <p>
093      If there are {@code k} spokes, then each circle around
094      the center will have {@code k} line segments. If there
095      are {@code n} concentric circles around the center (not
096      counting the inner most circle), then each spoke will
097      have {@code n} line segments.
098   <p>
099      There must be at least three spokes and at least one concentric circle.
100
101      @param r1  outer radius of the ring
102      @param r2  inner radius of the ring
103      @param n   number of concentric circles
104      @param k   number of spokes in the ring
105      @param type  choose between striped and checkerboard triangle strips
106      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 1
107      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 3
108   */
109   public Ring(final double r1, final double r2,
110               final int n, final int k,
111               final MeshType type)
112   {
113      super(String.format("Ring(%.2f,%.2f,%d,%d)", r1, r2, n, k));
114
115      if (n < 1)
116         throw new IllegalArgumentException("n must be greater than 0");
117      if (k < 3)
118         throw new IllegalArgumentException("k must be greater than 2");
119
120      this.r1 = r1;
121      this.r2 = r2;
122      this.n = n;
123      this.k = k;
124      this.type = type;
125
126      // Create the rings's geometry.
127
128      final double deltaR = (r1 - r2) / n,
129                   deltaTheta = (2 * Math.PI) / k;
130
131      // An array of vertices to be used to create triangles.
132      final Vertex[][] v = new Vertex[n+1][k];
133
134      // Create all the vertices.
135      for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j) // choose a spoke (an angle)
136      {
137         final double c = Math.cos(j * deltaTheta),
138                      s = Math.sin(j * deltaTheta);
139         for (int i = 0; i < n + 1; ++i) // move along the spoke
140         {
141            final double ri = r2 + i * deltaR;
142            v[i][j] = new Vertex(ri * c,
143                                 ri * s,
144                                 0);
145         }
146      }
147
148      // Add all of the vertices to this model.
149      for (int i = 0; i < n + 1; ++i)
150      {
151         for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j)
152         {
153            addVertex( v[i][j] );
154         }
155      }
156
157      // Create all the triangle strips.
158      if (MeshType.HORIZONTAL == type)
159      {
160         for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) // choose a circle of latitude
161         {
162            final Primitive triStrip = new TriangleStrip();
163            for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j) // choose a line of longitude
164            {
165               triStrip.addIndex(   i * k + j); // v[i  ][j]
166               triStrip.addIndex((1+i)* k + j); // v[i+1][j]
167            }
168            triStrip.addIndex(   i * k + 0); // v[i  ][0]
169            triStrip.addIndex((1+i)* k + 0); // v[i+1][0]
170            addPrimitive(triStrip);
171         }
172      }
173      else if (MeshType.VERTICAL == type)
174      {
175         for (int j = 0; j < k - 1; ++j) // choose a line of longitude
176         {
177            final Primitive triStrip = new TriangleStrip();
178            for (int i = 0; i < n + 1; ++i) // choose a circle of latitude
179            {
180               triStrip.addIndex((i+0) * k + j+1);  // v[i][j+1]
181               triStrip.addIndex((i+0) * k + j);    // v[i][j  ]
182            }
183            addPrimitive(triStrip);
184         }
185         final Primitive triStrip = new TriangleStrip();
186         for (int i = 0; i < n + 1; ++i) // choose a circle of latitude
187         {
188            triStrip.addIndex((i+0) * k + 0);    // v[i][0  ]
189            triStrip.addIndex((i+0) * k + k-1);  // v[i][k-1]
190         }
191         addPrimitive(triStrip);
192      }
193      else // MeshType.CHECKER triangle strips
194      {
195         for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) // choose a circle of latitude
196         {
197            for (int j = 0; j < k - 1; ++j) // choose a line of longitude
198            {
199               addPrimitive(
200                  new TriangleStrip(  i * k + j,       // v[i  ][j  ]
201                                   (1+i)* k + j,       // v[i+1][j  ]
202                                      i * k + j + 1,   // v[i  ][j+1]
203                                   (1+i)* k + j + 1)); // v[i+1][j+1]
204            }
205            addPrimitive(
206               new TriangleStrip(  i * k + k - 1, // v[i  ][k-1]
207                                (1+i)* k + k - 1, // v[i+1][k-1]
208                                   i * k + 0,     // v[i  ][0]
209                                (1+i)* k + 0));   // v[i+1][0]
210         }
211      }
212   }
213
214
215
216   // Implement the MeshMaker_TP interface (four methods).
217   @Override public int getHorzCount() {return n;}
218
219   @Override public int getVertCount() {return k;}
220
221   @Override public MeshType getType() {return type;}
222
223   @Override
224   public Ring remake(final int n, final int k, final MeshType type)
225   {
226      return new Ring(this.r1, this.r2,
227                      n, k,
228                      type);
229   }
230}//Ring
